issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: complex type support in LLAP IO is broken
Disable LLAP IO when complex types are involved

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

comments.body: It appears that the patch allows the complex types (previously blocked by Vectorizer) to enter LLAP IO; previously, those paths were never executed. Now they are and hence the errors
Seems like column ID handling is incorrect; it doesn't account for nested types, but also conflates table vs orc columns. I'll fix next week

Partial patch that fixes a couple issues and idenitifies the next one where context is not created for a certain column that has no data streams, the assumption that for every column there would be a context at corresponding position is broken.
Probably easy to fix depending on what 0 data streams mean - nothing to be read for that column? 
Then perhaps something else will break.

I also modified the test. So far it fails.

Patch backup... gets as far as positionInStreams :) I am still looking at it today. Fixed some issues with new schema logic and various indexing issues caused by nesting (probably a similar problem in positionInStreams...). Please do not remove existing logic changes if making another WIP patch on top

The latest error is too ORC for me to figure out immediately... will look next week unless you know what it could be cc [~prasanth_j]
Looks like position provider is missing stuff for nested reader?
{noformat}

The patch is very stale, will return to it shortly
Still a WIP patch; rebase
Fixing schema-related issues to get back to the previous error :)
WIP patch backup. Passing proper indexes to seek but it looks like columnIds are off, or something
Finishing the index fix
